page.title: 18The Museum:Chatteris(2)
page.content: Visitors to the museum have been as high as 650 in a year. This includes private parties from outside Chatteris who can visit in the evenings. The oldest exhibit is an axehead dating from c300,000BC found at Blunt's Farm near Manea. It is the only one of its kind in the country and was perhaps brought here by a hunting party crossing to Britain when it was still joined to mainland Europe. Apart from the exhibits there are also old maps, newspapers and tapes with recollections of older residents. Members of the museum have taken part in fieldwork and have noted that with increasing farm mechanisation, people are less likely to notice objects in the ground. They also liase with schools and the Women's Institute and are invited to speak at meetings.
